refnamediv.refpurpose: Reads data from the software bus.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Reads data from a channel of the inward named software bus. Implies declaring the channel with imode=1 (see also chn_k, chn_a, and chn_S).

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: Sname -- a string that identifies a channel of the named software bus to read.
Sname[] -- an array of named software channels to query.
ival -- the control value read at i-time.
Sval -- the string value read at i-time.
ival[] -- an array of control values read at i-time.
Sval{} -- an array of strings read at i-time.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: kval -- the control value read at performance time.
kval[] -- an array of control values read at performance time.
aval -- the audio signal read at performance time.
aval[] -- the array of audio vectors read at performance time.
Sval -- the string value read at k-rate. The chnget opcode works both at i-time and perf-time, whereas chngetks works only at perf-time. String variables are only updated if the channel has changed.

note.para: Although it is possible to loop through channel names from an array with chnget and chnset, using the array based variants is more efficient.

refsect1.title: Example
refsect1.para: The example shows the software bus being used as an asynchronous control signal to select a filter cutoff. It assumes that an external program that has access to the API is feeding the values.

informalexample.programlisting:
sr = 44100 kr = 100 ksmps = 1
instr 1 kc chnget "cutoff" a1 oscil p4, p5, 100 a2 lowpass2 a1, kc, 200 out a2 endin
